info.game_comments:
1998 College Championship quarterfinal game 5.
From Zellerbach Auditorium at the University of California-Berkeley.

(1, 1).clue: At Southern Nazarene Univ., you can find a happy medium by majoring in the print or broadcast type of this

(2, 1).clue: This state's first community college was established in Fresno in 1910

(3, 1).clue: In 1997 the Fighting Sioux of the Univ. of this "North" state won their 6th NCAA hockey title

(4, 1).clue: Oil-checking device that's used as slang for a stupid person

(5, 1).clue: It wouldn't be barbecue night without this, scientific name Zea mays

(6, 1).clue: Conan O'Brien sharpened his comedy skills at this university by writing for its famous Lampoon

(1, 2).clue: The 2 languages you'll most likely have to learn as a classics major

(2, 2).clue: It's home to Concordia College as well as the University of Michigan

(3, 2).clue: Pat Summitt has led this school's Lady Volunteers to 5 NCAA basketball championships in the past 11 years

(4, 2).clue: Something that doesn't require much use of your gray matter is a "no" this

(5, 2).clue: These Mexican "sandwiches", whose name means "plug", can be made with crisp or soft tortillas

(6, 2).clue: This magazine editor seen here played Antonio in "The Tempest" when he was a student at Brown in 1981

(1, 3).clue: Anthropology majors study them as group ways of life; biology majors grow them in petri dishes

(2, 3).clue: Even if Gallaudet weren't here, it's still quite the party town... a 2-party town mainly

(3, 3).clue: (Hi, I'm Summer Sanders.)  In 1992 I led this school, now attended by Chelsea Clinton, to a national swimming championship

(5, 3).clue: Italian for "little turnip", these cheese-filled pillows are served on pasta night in the dining hall

(6, 3).clue: Janet Reno was president, not attorney general of the women's student govt. at this Ithaca, N.Y. school

(1, 4).clue: Washington State offers majors in both this social science & the "home" version

(2, 4).clue: In 1942 the University of this city was the site of the first controlled nuclear chain reaction

(3, 4).clue: From 1962 through 1997, this North Carolina men's basketball coach had an NCAA record 879 wins

(4, 4).clue: If you do it with "a dime" you inform on someone

(5, 4).clue: Combine greens, veggies & dressing at this counter the dining hall calls "The Garden of Eatin'"

(6, 4).clue: As a student at Berkeley in '76, she had her first short story published, maybe while "Waiting to Exhale"

(1, 5).clue: College major of the man seen here; he's also taught the subject

(2, 5).clue: Ex-senator Sam Nunn is on the Emory board of trustees, which meets in this city

(3, 5).clue: In 1997 Ohio State's Blaine Wilson won the rings, vault & all-around titles in this sport

(4, 5).clue: Hit someone "on his hip" & you've sent him a message this way

(5, 5).clue: The dining hall's carving board features roast beef & this bird, Meleagris gallopavo

(6, 5).clue: It's no rumour; while studying at Oxford this politician seen here sang with the rock band Ugly Rumours

(1, 1).clue: Major John Andre, this traitor's contact on the British side, was hanged in 1780

(2, 1).clue: Appropriately, a Spin Doctors tune is used as this sitcom's theme

(3, 1).clue: Of the 3 branches of the U.S. government, it's the one that makes the laws

(4, 1).clue: "A low, dull quick sound... such as a watch makes when enveloped in cotton" is from this Poe story

(5, 1).clue: It's the event portrayed in a Jan van Eyck painting seen here

(6, 1).clue: Typical college course in which you learn about proper food & diet

(1, 2).clue: In 1923 he was an obscure major stationed in Panama; 30 years later he was U.S. president
